entry.title: Sybil and I hosted Bhutan‚Äôs King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, who is here on an unofficial visit for brunch. We had a meaningful discussion on the role mindfulness carries within global leadership and the value of meditation. We then discussed global a
entry.content: Sybil and I hosted Bhutan‚Äôs King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, who is here on an unofficial visit for brunch. We had a meaningful discussion on the role mindfulness carries within global leadership and the value of meditation. We then discussed global and regional economic challenges as well as Bhutan‚Äôs visions for the future.

entry.title: After a long day of meetings, we managed to tabao food from Tiong Bahru Food Centre. Guess which one is my favourite?

entry.title: I am a huge fan of all our hawker food and enjoyed all 3 dishes yesterday although I did eat more of the ngoh hiang! Today Sybil went to tapao for everyone from Tai Wah! Some of you remembered my all time fave is ta mee pok extra chili. What is your favou
entry.content: I am a huge fan of all our hawker food and enjoyed all 3 dishes yesterday although I did eat more of the ngoh hiang! Today Sybil went to tapao for everyone from Tai Wah! Some of you remembered my all time fave is ta mee pok extra chili. What is your favourite hawker food and where is it from?

entry.title: Met my friend Catholic Archbishop Marco Tin Win from Mandalay, Myanmar. He shared with me his dream of building a small meditation centre in the hills of Mandalay. Myanmar as a Buddhist country is steeped in the tradition of meditation but the Catholic C
entry.content: Met my friend Catholic Archbishop Marco Tin Win from Mandalay, Myanmar. He shared with me his dream of building a small meditation centre in the hills of Mandalay. Myanmar as a Buddhist country is steeped in the tradition of meditation but the Catholic Church had placed little emphasis on the interior life. Catholics have grown up in a Buddhist environment with a longing and capacity for silence and meditation. At the national level, the oeople have been going through a tough time with the unstable political situation and the Covid pandemic. Hence the urgent need for a place of silence to heal the trauma of war and conflict. I agreed to lend my support for Bishop Marco‚Äôs worthwhile endeavour.
